summary: The Mid-South Oilseed Double Cropping Study Act of 2025 mandates the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation to research and develop the inclusion of rapeseed and canola crops within double and rotational cropping insurance policies. The bill aims to evaluate the impact on insurance availability and cost, alongside potential risk management benefits like improved soil health and biodiversity. It requires the Corporation to consult with stakeholders and report findings to relevant congressional committees within 13 months, with an emphasis on qualified researchers with prior experience and facilities.
